verses.text: Hear my prayer, O \sc Lord\sc*, Give ear to my supplications: In thy faithfulness answer me, \add and\add* in thy righteousness.
And enter not into judgment with thy servant: For in thy sight shall no \add man\add* living be justified.
For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; He hath smitten my life down to the ground; He hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.
Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; My heart within me is desolate.
I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.
I stretch forth my hands unto thee: My soul \add thirsteth\add* after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.
Hear me speedily, O \sc Lord\sc*: my spirit faileth: Hide not thy face from me, Lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.
Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; For in thee do I trust: Cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; For I lift up my soul unto thee.
Deliver me, O \sc Lord\sc*, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.
Teach me to do thy will; for thou \add art\add* my God: Thy spirit \add is\add* good; lead me into the land of uprightness.
Quicken me, O \sc Lord\sc*, for thy name’s sake: For thy righteousness’ sake bring my soul out of trouble.
And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, And destroy all them that afflict my soul: For I \add am\add* thy servant.
